hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{871}$ as $\purpleC{8\text{ hundreds}}$, $\purpleC{7\text{ tens}}$, and $\purpleC{1 \text{ one}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{140}$ as $\blueD{1\text{ hundred}}$  and $\blueD{4\text{ tens}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{871}+\blueD{140}$

$=\purpleC{8\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{7\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{1\text{ one}}+\blueD{1\text{ hundred}}+\blueD{4\text{ tens}}$

$= \purpleC{8\text{ hundreds}}+\blueD{1\text{ hundred}}+\purpleC{7\text{ tens}}+\blueD{4\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{1\text{ one}}$
The answer: $ 8\text{ hundreds} + 1 \text{ hundred}+7 \text{ tens}+4 \text{ tens}+1\text{ one}$

question.content:
**Which expression could be used to find the value of $871+140$?**
